dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The Diamond Princess is finally docking in Laem Chabang, Thailand, on Thursday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Diamond Princess is finally docking in Laem Chabang, Thailand, on Thursday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Holland America Lines MS Westerdam was banned from docking by Thailand earlier this week, over concerns about coronavirus on the ship. It will now dock in Sihanoukville in Cambodia on Thursday, where passengers will disembark over a few day and will be transported to the capital, Phnom Penh, and flown home.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, after being turned away by Vietnam and a bunch of other ports. It's just a seasonal flu outbreak, right? Not coronavirus.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, after being turned away by Vietnam and a bunch of other ports. It's just a seasonal flu outbreak, right? Not coronavirus.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A cruise ship that was turned away from several ports in Asia over coronavirus fearsdespite no cases onboardwill now dock in Cambodia after days of uncertainty and mounting anxiety among passengers. The MS Westerdam had planned to disembark its passengers in Thailand after Japan, The Philippines and Guam turned away the cruise ship.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly—Norwegian Cruise Line says it's only crew with mild flu symptoms, but the panic has been unreal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly-Norwegian Cruise Line says it's only crew with mild flu symptoms, but the panic has been unreal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Holland America Line, which is owned by Carnival Cruise, says nobody onboard has reported symptoms. All guests on board are healthy and despite erroneous reports there are no known or suspected cases of coronavirus on board, nor have their ever been.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they're not even refunding passengers or paying for their flights home? That's rough.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're not even refunding passengers or paying for their flights home? That's rough.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Holland America Line says it will pay for the flight sand refund passengers their entire trip.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Susan Hansen, one of the passengers, called the government responses "absolutely astounding." She said they were told it was Covid-19, but it was just a common cold.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Susan Hansen, one of the passengers, called the government responses absolutely astounding. She said they were told it was Covidminus nineteen, but it was just a common cold.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Stephen Hansen and his wife are two of the 1,500 passengers stuck on the vessel, which sailed from Hong Kong on February 1st and had been scheduled to end its cruise in Japan on February 15. Hansen told Forbes: While I can understand that countries want to protect their own citizens first before helping us their decisions to turn us away are based more on misinformation and fear than facts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds like political gamesmanship, like she said. Countries are just scared.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It sounds like political gamesmanship, like she said. Countries are just scared.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And now Thailand's offering fuel and supplies, which is something at least.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now Thailand's offering fuel and supplies, which is something at least.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Thai government on Tuesday offered fuel, food, and medicine to the cruise ship.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But can you imagine being stuck on that ship since February 10th? With all that uncertainty?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But can you imagine being stuck on that ship since February tenth? With all that uncertainty?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Stephen Hansen and his wife are two of the 1,500 passengers stuck on the vessel, which sailed from Hong Kong on February 1st and had been scheduled to end its cruise in Japan on February 15.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, they're escorting it with a Thai naval frigate. That's intense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, they're escorting it with a Thai naval frigate. That's intense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Twitter, another passenger on the MS Westerdam tweeted that the vessel was being escorted by a naval ship, the Thai Navy frigate Bhumibol Adulyadej.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Cruise ships are really becoming flashpoints in this whole outbreak. Remember the Westerdam situation?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Cruise ships are really becoming flashpoints in this whole outbreak. Remember the Westerdam situation?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Cruise ships have become an unlikely flashpoint in the battle to stop the international spread of the coronavirus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, quarantined in Tokyo with hundreds sick. It's a mess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, quarantined in Tokyo with hundreds sick. It's a mess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The British-owned Diamond Princess cruise was quarantined in Tokyo last Monday, with 174 out of the 3,700 passengers on board now ill with the pneumonia-like illness. All guests on board are healthy and despite erroneous reports there are no known or suspected cases of coronavirus on board, nor have their ever been.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the industry's barring anyone who's been to China recently. It's just precaution after precaution.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the industry's barring anyone who's been to China recently. It's just precaution after precaution.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Cruise Lines International Association, the industrys trade organization, announced last week its members would bar passengers who had visited China, Hong Kong, or Macau, 14 days before their cruise, from boarding.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, you've got over 2,000 people on board just wanting to go home.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, you've got over two thousand people on board just wanting to go home.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And no one's making it easy for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And no one's making it easy for them.

artist_script:
HostA: The Diamond Princess is finally docking in Laem Chabang, Thailand, on Thursday.
HostB: Yeah, after being turned away by Vietnam and a bunch of other ports. It’s just a seasonal flu outbreak, right? Not coronavirus.
HostA: Exactly—Norwegian Cruise Line says it’s only crew with mild flu symptoms, but the panic has been unreal.
HostB: And they’re not even refunding passengers or paying for their flights home? That’s rough.
HostA: Susan Hansen, one of the passengers, called the government responses "absolutely astounding." She said they were told it was Covid-19, but it was just a common cold.
HostB: It sounds like political gamesmanship, like she said. Countries are just scared.
HostA: And now Thailand’s offering fuel and supplies, which is something at least.
HostB: But can you imagine being stuck on that ship since February 10th? With all that uncertainty?
HostA: Plus, they’re escorting it with a Thai naval frigate. That’s intense.
HostB: Cruise ships are really becoming flashpoints in this whole outbreak. Remember the Westerdam situation?
HostA: Oh yeah, quarantined in Tokyo with hundreds sick. It’s a mess.
HostB: And the industry’s barring anyone who’s been to China recently. It’s just precaution after precaution.
HostA: Still, you’ve got over 2,000 people on board just wanting to go home.
HostB: And no one’s making it easy for them.
